com.blockwithme.util.shared

Class Footprint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blockwithme.util.shared.Footprint

  • public class Footprint
extends Object
    Helper class to compute the approximate memory footprint of an object. TODO Add methods to compute the size of java.util.Collections, to make size computation easier... FYI: I have computed the size of the Boolean class itself, to about 630 bytes of the JVM ram. This should give us an order of magnitude about the size of Class themselves.
    Author:
    monster

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ARRAY_SIZE
      How big is an empty array (approximately)?
      static boolean JVM_64_BITS
      Are we in 64 bits?
      static int OBJECT_SIZE
      How big is an object without data (approximately)?
      static int REFERENCE
      How big is an object reference? (We assume compressed pointers in 64 bit)

      Constructor and Description
      Footprint() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int array(AnyType type, int size)
      Returns the (rounded) footprint for an array of the given type, with the given size.
      static int object(AnyType... fields)
      Returns the (rounded) size of an object with the given fields.
      static int objectArray(int size, int avgObjectFootprint)
      Returns the footprint for an array as array(AnyType.Object, size), plus size * avgObjectFootprint.
      static int round(int footprint)
      Rounds the footprint to an appropriate multiple of the architecture "word" size.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Footprint

        public Footprint()

    • Method Detail

      • round

        public static int round(int footprint)
        Rounds the footprint to an appropriate multiple of the architecture "word" size.

      • array

        public static int array(AnyType type,
        int size)
        Returns the (rounded) footprint for an array of the given type, with the given size. For objects, does NOT contain the size of the objects themselves, but only the size taken by the object-reference within the array.

      • objectArray

        public static int objectArray(int size,
              int avgObjectFootprint)
        Returns the footprint for an array as array(AnyType.Object, size), plus size * avgObjectFootprint. Note that avgObjectFootprint should take null, ... into consideration, when deciding on an average.

      • object

        public static int object(AnyType... fields)
        Returns the (rounded) size of an object with the given fields. Does NOT take into consideration, the size of the child objects, pointed to by the references. Remember to include the fields of the base-classes.
